  - Build date: 2022-05-27T11:05:36.428255-05:00[America/Chicago]

*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.8+
2. Maven (3.8.3+)/Gradle (7.2+)

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>com.finix</groupId>
  <artifactId>finix-java</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
  repositories {
    mavenCentral()     // Needed if the 'finix-java' jar has been published to maven central.
    mavenLocal()       // Needed if the 'finix-java' jar has been published to the local maven repo.
  }

  dependencies {
     implementation "com.finix:finix-java:1.0.0-SNAPSHOT"
  }
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/finix-java-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

// Import classes:
import invoker.FinixClient;
import invoker.ApiException;
import invoker.Configuration;
import invoker.auth.*;
import invoker.models.*;
import api.ApplicationProfilesApi;

public class Example {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    FinixClient defaultClient = Configuration.getDefaultFinixClient();
    defaultClient.setBasePath("https://finix.sandbox-payments-api.com");
    
    // Configure HTTP basic authorization: BasicAuth
    HttpBasicAuth BasicAuth = (HttpBasicAuth) defaultClient.getAuthentication("BasicAuth");
    BasicAuth.setUsername("YOUR USERNAME");
    BasicAuth.setPassword("YOUR PASSWORD");

    ApplicationProfilesApi apiInstance = new ApplicationProfilesApi(defaultClient);
    String applicationProfileId = "applicationProfileId_example"; // String | ID of application profile to use
    try {
      ApplicationProfile result = apiInstance.getApplicationProfile(applicationProfileId);
      System.out.println(result);
    } catch (ApiException e) {
      System.err.println("Exception when calling ApplicationProfilesApi#getApplicationProfile");
      System.err.println("Status code: " + e.getCode());
      System.err.println("Reason: " + e.getResponseBody());
      System.err.println("Response headers: " + e.getResponseHeaders());
      e.printStackTrace();
    }
  }
}

```

## Documentation for Authorization

Authentication schemes defined for the API:
### BasicAuth

- **Type**: HTTP basic authentication


## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `FinixClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.

## Author

support@finixpayments.com
